Property.Desc: Base name of HTML page pointed to by index.htm, and for the HOME button.
name of the index file generated: use index_sd.htm for SD skins; index.htm is good for HD skins
Regex of files to skip during cleaning
List of directories to copy from the skin directory to the jukebox
The maximum number of genres to display per movie
The maximum number of actors to display per movie
Include full movie details in the index xml files
Reduce the number of genres
Sorting prefixes to ignore
Ordering of certifications as displayed on the main index page. If Another rating exists for a movie that isn't listed here, it will simply be appended to the end.
Use the short plot or long plot description from IMDB
Use the short plot or long plot description from Filmweb
Lookup and include the television episode Plot in the XML file
Settings for downloading movie fanart. If set to true this will save the fanart to the Jukebox folder.
Width etting for downloading movie fanart.
Height setting for downloading movie fanart.
Settings for downloading TV fanart. If set to true this will save the fanart to the Jukebox folder.
Width setting for downloading TV fanart.
Height setting for downloading TV fanart.
This determines the extensions of the files that will be scanned for fanart.

This is the extension to the video name to scan for fanart. This should be a value that shouldn't occur in any video filenames and should occur at the end of the video filename. If no fanart is found for a video, the normal download will be run.
Maximum number of thumbnails per index page
Maximum number of thumbnails per line in the index page
Maximum number of TV Show thumbnails per index page
Maximum number of TV Show thumbnails per line in the index page
Thumbnails format
Generated thumbnail width
Generated thumbnail height
Add an HD logo to the thumbnail when the movie is 720p or 1080p
Add an TV logo to the thumbnail if the video is a tv show
Add a set logo to the thumbnail if the poster is a set master
Add a subtitle logo to the thumbnail if the video has subtitles
Add a language specific icon (flag) to the thumbnail
Thumbnails resizing policy. When true, the generated thumbnails will be exactly WIDTHxHEIGHT (=> cropped images). When false, the original poster aspect ratio is respected.
Add reflection to the generated thumbnails
Percentage of the height of the poster to use as reflection effect.
Reflection gradient starts at this percentage of the reflection height
Reflection gradient ends at this percentage of the reflection height
Opacity start value
Opacity ending value
Add a perspective effect to the generated thumbnails
Percentage of the height of the thumbnail to use for perspective.
Percentage of the height of the thumbnail to use for perspective.
The direction of the perspective.
Turn on/off the rounded corners of the thumbnails
The radius (size) of the round corners.

Add a frame with a defined thickness (= frameSize) around the Image depending on resolution (SD, HD, 720p, 1080p) it can be filled with RGB color; default is White (255, 255, 255). Note: for 720p and 1080p differentiation, "highdef.differentiate=true" must be set.
The thickness in pixels of the frame around the image.
The frame color (r/g/b) for SD video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for HD video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 720p video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.
Add new Overlay/Logo - possible Sources from XML
The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.
Posters format
Generated poster width
Generated poster height
Posters resizing policy. When true, the generated posters will be exactly WIDTHxHEIGHT (=> cropped images). When false, the original poster aspect ratio is respected.
Add reflection to the generated posters
Add an HD logo to the poster when the movie is 720p or 1080p
Add an TV logo to the poster if the video is a tv show
Add a subtitle logo to the poster if the video has subtitles
Add a language specific icon (flag) to the poster

Opacity start value
Opacity ending value
Add a perspective effect to the generated posters
Percentage of the height of the poster to use for perspective.
Percentage of the height of the poster to use for perspective.
The direction of the perspective.
Turn on/off the rounded corners of the posters
The radius (size) of the round corners.

Add a frame with a defined thickness (= frameSize) around the Image depending on resolution (SD, HD, 720p, 1080p) it can be filled with RGB color; default is White (255, 255, 255). Note: for 720p and 1080p differentiation, "highdef.differentiate=true" must be set.
The thickness in pixels of the frame around the image.
The frame color (r/g/b) for SD video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for HD video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 720p video.
The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.

The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.

The frame color (r/g/b) for 1080p video.
Download Season Wide Banners. Currently only works with TV Episodes.
Only download series banners and not specific season banners
Attempt to download different series banners for each season. Works if "mjb.seriesOnlyBanners=false" and there are no season banners and "mjb.seriesOnlyBanners=true".

Generated banner width
Generated banner height
Banners resizing policy. When true, the generated banners will be exactly WIDTHxHEIGHT (=> cropped images). When false, the original banner aspect ratio is respected.

Add an TV logo to the banner if the video is a tv show

Lookup and include the video image for each part of the video. Currently only works with TV Episodes.

Add an TV logo to the VideoImage if the video is a tv show

This is the fully qualified name of the plugin class implementing the thumbnail/poster/background generator for movie posters. If you don't know what all this is about, DO NOT CHANGE THESE VALUES.
This is the fully qualified name of the plugin class implementing the thumbnail/poster/background generator for movie posters. If you don't know what all this is about, DO NOT CHANGE THESE VALUES.
Differentiate between 720p and 1080p. If this property is not set or false, then the highdef.720.width will be used to determine if a video is HD.
The width of the video to define 720p. Note this will be used if highdef.differentiate=false to calculate a high-definition video.
The width of the video to define 1080p

Category.name: Special Characters

Property.Desc: Special accented character replacement for indexing purposes. This is a comma-separated list. The first character is the accent character followed by a hypen - and then the character to replace it with for indexing.

Category.Property: > Group all english chars in single AZ category
